revised_title: Italian Scientific Developments and Publications in the Early 18th Century
tldr: The author, P. Silvestre, provides an account of new books and manuscripts in Italy, focusing on the works of Malpighi, Borelli, and Valsalva. He discusses the state of scientific study after Malpighi's death, the upcoming publications on anatomy, botany, and the structure of glands, as well as the preparations of the human organ of hearing by Valsalva.
